revisions.rev:
'''Diane Greene''' was a founder of [[VMware]] and the CEO from 1998 to 2008. Greene, [[Mendel Rosenblum]], Scott Devine, Edward Wang and [[Edouard Bugnion]] founded VMware in 1998.<ref>{{ cite web |url=http://www.vmware.com/company/leadership.html |title=VMware Leadership}}</ref>
Born in [[Rochester, New York]], Greene received her [[bachelor's degree]] in mechanical engineering in 1976 from the [[University of Vermont]],<ref>{{cite web|title=The Wall Street Journal List - One of the Journal's 50|url=http://alumni.uvm.edu/vq/summer2008/journal.asp|date=2008 (Summer)|publisher=Vermont Quarterly, [[University of Vermont]]}}</ref> and earned a Master's Degree in [[Naval architecture|Naval Architecture]] from [[MIT]] in 1978. In 1988 she earned a second Master's Degree in Computer Science from the [[University of California at Berkeley]].<ref>{{Cite web |accessdate=2007-10-04 |last=Lashinsky |url=http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/2007/10/15/100536853/ |first=Adam |publisher=Fortune Magazine |title=Full speed ahead |date=2007-10-02}}</ref> Rosenblum and Greene, who are married, first met while at Berkeley.<ref>"In 1988 she picked up a second master's, in computer science, at the [[University of California, Berkeley]], where she met Rosenblum."{{cite web|url=http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/2007/10/15/100536853/index.htm|author=Adam Lashinksky|date=2007-10-02|title=50 Most Powerful Women in Business - Full speed ahead|publisher=[[CNN]]}}</ref>
On July 8, 2008, Greene was unexpectedly fired as president and CEO by the VMware Board of Directors and replaced by [[Paul Maritz]], a retired 14-year [[Microsoft]] veteran.<ref>{{cite web |author=Savitz, Eric |url= http://blogs.barrons.com/techtraderdaily/2008/07/08/vmware-ousts-ceo-diane-greene-cuts-08-guidance/ |title=VMware ousts CEO Diane Greene; cuts '08 guidance |work=Barronâs |date=2008-07-08 |accessdate=2011-05-21}}</ref>
Since August 2006, Greene has been on the board of directors of [[Intuit]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Intuit board of directors|url=http://investors.intuit.com/directors.cfm|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/62rwONlbV|archivedate=2011-11-01|date=2011-11-01}}</ref>
